solution_line_template: The manuscript is {num_pages} pages and the printers charge ${cost_per_page} per page for a total of {num_pages}*{cost_per_page} = $<<{num_pages}*{cost_per_page}={copying_cost_per_manuscript}>>{copying_cost_per_manuscript} per manuscript

She needs {num_copies} copies made and it costs ${copying_cost_per_manuscript} per manuscript so that's {num_copies}*{copying_cost_per_manuscript} = $<<{num_copies}*{copying_cost_per_manuscript}={total_copying_cost}>>{total_copying_cost}

She also needs each of the {num_copies} copies to be bound, which is ${binding_cost_per_manuscript} per manuscript so that's {binding_cost_per_manuscript}*{num_copies} = $<<{num_copies}*{binding_cost_per_manuscript}={total_binding_cost}>>{total_binding_cost}

It will cost ${total_copying_cost} to have them printed and ${total_binding_cost} to have them bound for a total of {total_copying_cost}+{total_binding_cost} = $<<{total_copying_cost}+{total_binding_cost}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}
